answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.Did he have a transmural infarct? or was it TIA, transient ischemic attack? Either way the burning at the back of his head may not be related to these two conditions. The burning could be due to neuropathy. It is a disorder of the nerves which causes numbness, tingling, burning, unusual sensations and sometimes pain. Diabetes Mellitus can cause neuropathy. Other causes like vitamin deficiencies, alcohol consumption and certain medications can cause neuropathy. He may need to consult his primary care physician to detect the cause.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.
